name.paramonov.doomep.shogi

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • name.paramonov.doomep.shogi.GameState

  • public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing the state of the game at any given moment. Stores the board and the contents of the two drop tables. Can be considered the table the game is being played on.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameState()
      Constructs a new, empty game state.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameState

        public GameState()
        Constructs a new, empty game state. Constructs a game state with a 9*9 board, filled with EmptyPieces, and with empty drop tables.

    • Method Detail

        Returns the board at a given point in time.
        Returns:
        The List<List<Piece>> that represents the game board.

        public java.util.List<Piece> getDropTable1()
        Return the drop table of player 1 at a given point in time.
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • addPieceToDropTable

        public void addPieceToDropTable(int allegiance,
                       Piece piece)
        Adds a piece to the drop table of a given player. Appens a Piece to the List that represents the drop table with the given allegiance.
        Parameters:
        allegiance - The drop table to be added to. Either 1 or -1.
        piece - The piece to be added to the drop table.
